MUMBAI : After almost eight months of discussions , Tata Communications has finally agreed to sell its South African unit Neotel to Vodacom , an arm of British telecommunications giant Vodafone , for $ 676 million , or Rs 3,959 crore .

MUMBAI : After almost eight months of discussions , Tata Communications has finally agreed to sell its South African unit Neotel to Vodacom , an arm of British telecommunications giant Vodafone , for $ 676 million , or Rs 3,959 crore .

Neotel , in which the Tata Group holds 68.5 % stake , is South Africa 's second biggest fixed - line phone operator and the deal marks the salt - to - software conglomerate 's first bigticket overseas asset sale under chairman Cyrus Mistry .

Neotel , in which the Tata Group holds 68.5 % stake , is South Africa 's second biggest fixed - line phone operator and the deal marks the salt - to - software conglomerate 's first bigticket overseas asset sale under chairman Cyrus Mistry .

A0: the salt-to-software conglomerate 's first bigticket overseas asset sale under chairman Cyrus Mistry
RelatedSentence: The sale also puts the $ 100 - billion group 's globalization efforts in the reverse gear , as it joins several other Indian corporates feeling the heat of foreign acquisitions .

A0: the salt-to-software conglomerate 's first bigticket overseas asset sale under chairman Cyrus Mistry

RelatedSentence: The Tata Group is exiting Neotel as it no longer wants to engage in long term - financial commitments in a highly competitive market .

A0: The shareholders of Neotel and Vodacom
RelatedSentence: The shareholders of Neotel and Vodacom have concluded an agreement on the commercial structure and terms that will enable the latter to buy 100 % stake in Neotel , including shareholder loans against it , Tata Communications said in a statement .

The shareholders of Neotel and Vodacom have concluded an agreement on the commercial structure and terms that will enable the latter to buy 100 % stake in Neotel , including shareholder loans against it , Tata Communications said in a statement .

The shareholders of Neotel and Vodacom have concluded an agreement on the commercial structure and terms that will enable the latter to buy 100 % stake in Neotel , including shareholder loans against it , Tata Communications said in a statement .
South African investors Nexus Connection and Communitel own 19 % and 12.5 % respectively in Neotel , earlier known as SNO Telecommunications .
The Neotel sale will help the Vinod Kumar - headed Tata Communications to cut down its over Rs 11,000 - crore debt to some extent .

A0: Neotel to Vodacom , an arm of British telecommunications giant Vodafone , for $ 676 million , or Rs 3,959 crore
RelatedSentence: The deal is in line with our financial objectives , while paving the way for Neotel to improve its value proposition in the South African market , Kumar said .
The deal is in line with our financial objectives , while paving the way for Neotel to improve its value proposition in the South African market , Kumar said .
Neotel was established in 2005 after the South African government deregulated the telecom market , with the Tata Group initially acquiring a 26 % stake in the company .
